definition: to get rid of/to remove/to exclude/to eliminate/to wipe out/to divide/except/not including

sentences.english: Flow. Eliminate distractions, and really pour yourself into whatever you’re doing.
sentences.chinese: 摒除杂念，将你自己投入到你在做的事情中。

sentences.english: The noise gets in the way of your voice, so pare it down, trimming the noise from the bush until you’re left with truth.
sentences.chinese: 这种“噪音”混杂在你的心声中，所以必须把它摒除。
开始摒除死亡主义世界观。

sentences.english: This is not to dismiss doubts over the readiness of the two newcomers.
sentences.chinese: 但是这些并不能摒除对这两个新成员资格的怀疑。

sentences.english: I shall ever try to keep all untruths out from my thoughts.
sentences.chinese: 我将永远从我理想中摒除谬误。

sentences.english: Ray takes a long breath to calm himself down and exclude the idea out of his mind.
sentences.chinese: 雷长长的呼了一口气让自己平静下来并且摒除杂念。

sentences.english: Put away self-center, then you'll have happy life.
sentences.chinese: 契合空性，摒除自我执着，才有自在逍遥的人生。

sentences.english: Focus on bringing people together and eliminating divisiveness in speech and action.
sentences.chinese: 专注于团结众人之事及摒除分化的言语和行动。

sentences.english: The ethnic slag aside, he was right.
sentences.chinese: 摒除种族的偏见，他是对的。

sentences.english: Stop all your thoughts for a minute.

definition: to discard/to get rid of/to dispense with
to get rid of/to dismiss/to brush aside
to eliminate/to do away with/to get rid of
to try everything to avoid/to guard against
to concentrate one's attention/to be fully focused
